title: Python Developer With OBS Experience
description: Python Developer — GUI Software for Multi-Instance Live Stream Monitoring & Analysis Job Summary We are seeking an experienced Python Developer to design and develop a robust GUI-based application capable of controlling multiple instances of OBS Studio for live streaming from diverse sources such as TV channels, YouTube streams, IP cameras, etc. The application will perform real-time video OCR, audio transcription, and keyword detection on these live streams, with advanced recording and event-triggering logic. Key Responsibilities Design and implement a user-friendly GUI application to launch, manage, and monitor multiple OBS Studio instances, each streaming different live sources. Develop modules to perform real-time Video OCR on live video streams to extract text appearing on screen. Integrate audio processing components to record audio streams and generate accurate transcripts in real time. Implement a keyword detection engine that continuously scans OCR output and audio transcripts for predefined trigger keywords. Build logic to trigger video recording segments starting 1 minute before and ending 5 minutes after the keyword trigger event. Handle multiple simultaneous keyword triggers efficiently by managing recording overlaps and minimizing duplicate recordings. Maintain precise timestamping for all triggers and recording segments to ensure timeline accuracy. Ensure stable and reliable software performance, handling stream interruptions and automatic reconnections gracefully. Optimize processing to support real-time performance with low latency. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate with external systems or APIs as needed. Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code following best practices. Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure robust functionality. Required Skills & Qualifications Strong proficiency in Python programming, including GUI frameworks such as PyQt, Tkinter, or Kivy. Experience with OBS Studio automation and integration, including launching and controlling multiple instances programmatically. Expertise in video processing libraries such as OpenCV, and OCR tools like Tesseract OCR or similar. Knowledge of audio processing and speech-to-text technologies, including APIs (Google Speech-to-Text, Azure Cognitive Services, etc.) or open-source alternatives. Ability to implement real-time data processing and event-driven programming. Experience with concurrency and parallel processing to handle multiple streams simultaneously. Strong understanding of multimedia streaming protocols and formats (RTSP, HLS, MPEG-DASH). Familiarity with timestamp synchronization and buffering techniques for pre-trigger and post-trigger recording. Experience handling complex trigger logic, de-duplication, and conflict resolution in event-driven systems. Solid knowledge of software design patterns, version control (Git), and testing methodologies. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Preferred Qualifications Experience working with cloud services or APIs for speech recognition or video analysis. Familiarity with Docker or containerization for deploying multimedia applications. Prior exposure to real-time surveillance, broadcast automation, or media monitoring systems. Understanding of GUI/UX design principles for desktop applications. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Deliverables Fully functional GUI software capable of managing multiple OBS instances streaming different live sources. Real-time OCR and audio transcription modules integrated with the live streams. Keyword detection and triggering system with accurate video segment recording. Mechanisms to handle overlapping triggers and minimize redundant recordings. Documentation covering installation, configuration, and user manual. Unit and integration test suites ensuring software quality. Application Instructions Please submit your resume along with a portfolio or examples of relevant projects involving multimedia processing, GUI application development, or OBS integration.

title: Machine Learning Model for ASL Gesture Recognition
description: We are seeking a skilled machine learning expert to develop a real-time model that can interpret American Sign Language (ASL) gestures and convert them into coherent sentences. The ideal candidate will possess experience in computer vision and natural language processing, with a strong understanding of real-time data processing. The project aims to create a seamless user experience for ASL interpretation, facilitating improved communication. If you are passionate about bridging technology and language, we want to hear from you!

title: Voice AI Developer / Backend Engineer
description: Summary We’re seeking a skilled Backend Developer with a strong foundation in AI engineering and conversational‑flow systems to help evolve our Voice AI platform for dental practices. You’ll work directly with our CTO to refine and modularize our existing codebase, architect sophisticated function‑calling workflows for appointment booking (and other key actions), and build an experimental “playground” for our multi‑agent voice AI. You’ll also partner closely with front‑end engineers to deliver seamless integration of these capabilities into our clinic dashboard. Key Responsibilities: -Backend Architecture & Structure: Collaborate with the CTO to organize, document, and optimize the current Node.js/Python codebase for scalability and maintainability. - Function‑Calling Workflows: Design and implement advanced APIs and handlers for appointment scheduling, cancellations, reminders, insurance lookups, and other conversational actions. - AI Playground Development: Build and maintain a sandbox environment for testing multi‑agent interactions, prompt variations, and LLM behavior. -Cross‑Team Collaboration: Liaise with front‑end developers to ensure new backend services deploy smoothly on our React‑based dashboard and support real‑time voice call flows. -Enterprise‑Grade Reliability: Ensure services adhere to best practices for security, error handling, monitoring, and performance in AWS. Qualifications: -3+ years’ professional experience with Node.js, Python, AWS, and MongoDB -Proven expertise designing and deploying enterprise‑scale APIs and microservices -Deep understanding of LLMs, chat‑flow architectures, and conversational design -Experience working with voice/telephony platforms or multi‑agent systems is a plus -Strong communication skills and a collaborative, problem‑solving mindset

title: Automate Options Trading Strategy with Interactive Brokers API
description: We are looking for a skilled developer to automate an options trading strategy using the Interactive Brokers API. The ideal candidate should have experience with algorithmic trading and a strong understanding of options trading mechanics. You will be responsible for implementing, testing, and optimizing the trading strategy to ensure it performs effectively in live market conditions. We have a draft program ready as a starting point and the strategy has already been determined. It is for SPX same day options - the bot is to purchase the spread - there is no TP. Please include an estimate of your project costs. We are looking for a skilled programmer who has already written automation programs to trade options with Interactive Brokers. Not only trading, but options trading. We would like the software implemented in Python and working with QuantConnect, with the algorithm tested with PyTest. We would need to be able to do backtesting with the algorithm, so the algorithm can be modified. We are looking for someone who has: - can reference at least 2 completed relevant projects - can provide Python code samples of their work in the application - we are looking at turnaround time of 4 weeks, as this is not a complicated strategy, so if you have experience in creating API in IBKR, it should be relatively quick. You will be asked to answer the following questions when submitting a proposal: How much understanding do you have with options and trading? Have you created automated trading programs for api keys before? Describe your recent experience with similar projects. Can you complete the project in under a month? If you are interested in the project, we would love to hear from you.

title: Django Developer Needed to Transition Proof-of-Concept to Production
description: Greenova is an open-source Django platform for environmental professionals to track, manage, and report on compliance obligations. The project is modular, extensible, and at proof-of-concept stage. We seek a Django development firm or experienced freelancers to advance it to production readiness. Goals: - Deliver a robust, maintainable proof-of-concept for stakeholders. - Achieve high code quality, documentation, and test coverage. - Implement features in the [roadmap](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/ROADMAP.md) and open issues. Tech Stack: - Backend: Python 3.12.9, Django 5.2 - Frontend: Semantic HTML5, PicoCSS (classless), django-hyperscript, django-htmx - DB: SQLite3 (dev/prod) - Other: Protobuf3; SASS/PostCSS; TypeScript/AssemblyScript (optional) - Testing: pytest, pytest-django, pytest-cov, pytest-xdist - Linting: ruff, pylint, djlint, markdownlint, stylelint, eslint, shellcheck, ruff-format, isort, prettier, shfmt - Type Checking: mypy (strict), beartype, stubgen/stubtest Status: - Modular Django project ([codebase](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/tree/main/greenova)) - Core models, views, forms for obligation tracking - Initial APIs and admin - Comprehensive [documentation](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/tree/main/docs) - Open [issues](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/issues) and [PRs](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/pulls) Scope of Work (Summary): 1. Authentication: Integrate django-allauth (MFA), refactor templates for accessibility and PicoCSS, add runtime type checking, docstrings, and tests. 2. Projects & Mechanisms: User-facing CRUD, enforce relationships, strict type annotations, accessible forms. 3. Obligations: User-facing CRUD, validation, accessible forms, type annotations. 4. Responsibility Assignment: Add assignment UI, enforce permissions, type/refactor. 5. Compliance Status: Refactor dashboard, add filtering and drill-down, improve accessibility. 6. User & Company Profiles: User-facing CRUD, enforce permissions, type/refactor. 7. Drill-down Navigation: Implement user-facing drill-down (mechanism → procedure → obligation), filtering/sorting, accessible CRUD. 8. Overdue Obligations Tooltip: Add interactive, accessible tooltip for overdue obligations in dashboard. 9. Charts & Visualisations: Integrate matplotlib (static) and Plotly (interactive) for dashboards/reports; ensure accessibility; serialize data via protobuf3. 10. Protobuf3 Schemas: Implement/maintain protobuf3 for backend/external data serialization. 11. Code Review & Refactor: Ensure maintainability, readability, standards compliance. General Tasks: - Refactor for type annotations, docstrings, beartype decorators. - Use semantic HTML, PicoCSS, and ensure accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA). - Add/expand tests for all user flows. - Document all modules/workflows per project standards. Deliverables: - Refactored, documented Django codebase - Passing CI/pre-commit checks - 80%+ test coverage (100% for critical modules) - Validated type stubs (.pyi, py.typed) - Updated [documentation](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/tree/main/docs) - Summary report of changes and recommendations Timeline & Process: - Start: ASAP (kick-off Mon, 26 May 2025) - Due: 6 Jun 2025 - Applications reviewed for technical fit, code quality, and communication. - Shortlisted candidates may complete a small code review/test task. - Final selection based on merit and alignment with goals. To Apply: - Brief summary of your Django experience and code quality approach - References to similar projects/contributions (links preferred) - Proposed onboarding/review plan - Availability and timeline for initial phase Resources: - [README](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/README.md) - [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) - [API](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/API_DOCUMENTATION.md) - [Architecture](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md) - [Testing](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/TESTING.md) - [Roadmap](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/ROADMAP.md) - [Style Guide](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/style_guide.md) - [FAQ](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/FAQ.md) - [Issues](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/issues) - [Pull Requests](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/pulls) Info: - License: AGPL-3.0 - All work must comply with documentation, style, and accessibility requirements. - For questions, review the [FAQ](https://github.com/enveng-group/dev_greenova/blob/main/docs/FAQ.md) or open a GitHub issue.

title: Python And Api Expert Needed To Update An Existing Script To Work With Gemini and Minimax
description: I have a script that was written by someone which creates blog posts. It is a very complex script with about 8,000 lines of code. The script has different functions, such as being able to utilize different AI platforms for writing, different platforms for images, calling internal links, number of images, external links, youtube videos, etc. it hasn't been updated in over 6 months and is no linger supported by the person who wrote it. I need to make an update to it, or to completely re-work it (the choice is yours). I do not need it to work with all the different AI writing models, just Google Gemini. I also need it to only work with Minimax API for image creation. I still need to have the internal and external linking, the FAQ section (which needs 2catcha API, which is fine), and the ability to automatically post to Wordpress (back date and forward date, a function already there). Please let me know if you believe you have what it takes to do this project, and how long you think it would take. If you respond, make sure to include the word "apple" at the end of the message so I know you at least read it to the end. Without this, you will not even get the code block to review it to see if you can do the job.

title: Fast API Enginner Needed to build Enpoints
description: we are working on a script-based Micro CMS that allows marketing, legal, and support teams to update live website quickly. The core architecture is built with: FastAPI (Python) PostgreSQL Cloudflare (CDN) Fly.io (backend hosting) We’ve already completed: Core schema design (users, sites, configs, logs, API keys, audit trail) Admin and support roles Dynamic rule injection logic via JS A technical blueprint covering 40+ endpoints 🎯 Your Role You’ll be responsible for implementing the full API backend based on our design. This includes building ~43 endpoints across: ✅ User Auth & Account Management (signup, login, reset, profile) ✅ Site & Campaign CRUD (attach rules, publish, archive) ✅ Log tracking, analytics & metrics ✅ Support & Admin tools (impersonation, audit logs) ✅ API key handling & scopes ✅ Documentation and minimal test pages (optional) 👨‍💻 Required Skills 3+ years backend development experience (Python/FastAPI preferred) Strong with PostgreSQL, async ORMs like Databases or SQLAlchemy Experience with JWT/OAuth auth flows Familiarity with REST API design, status codes, and error handling Ability to read and build from a well-defined spec (you will receive docs + DB schema + curl tests) Familiarity with Cloudflare, rate limiting, or lightweight S3 JSON caching ⚙️ Dev Setup We’ll provide: Database schema (already running on Fly.io) CSV spec of endpoints + Markdown API doc Sample config/test HTML pages Frontend developer already building the dashboard — you will integrate with it 📦 Deliverables All 43 endpoints working and tested via Postman/curl Basic test routes or Swagger docs enabled Optional: Create dummy data loader or mock login session tool Optional: Implement caching, if experienced 🚀 To Apply Send a proposal with: GitHub or portfolio Relevant FastAPI/Postgres experience Availability (start date + time commitment per week) Your rate or expected compensation ( Amount in Job description is just a placeholder to make sure this was read) **FIXED FEE ONLY
